block.p: Tally Last Week in Connecticut, New Jersey and New York Senate

1. Replacement of Strikers: Vote to cut off debate and begin consideration of a bill intended to keep employers from permanently replacing workers striking over wages and benefits. Failed, with 53 in favor and 48 opposed (seven votes short of the 60 needed), July 13.
Tally Last Week in Connecticut, New Jersey and New York Senate

1. Replacement of Strikers: Vote to cut off debate and begin consideration of a bill intended to keep employers from permanently replacing workers striking over wages and benefits. Failed, with 53 in favor and 48 opposed (seven votes short of the 60 needed), July 13.
Connecticut Dodd (D) . . . Yea Lieberman (D) . . . Yea New Jersey Bradley (D) . . . Yea Lautenberg (D) . . . Yea New York D'Amato (R) . . . Yea Moynihan (D) . . . Yea House

1. Hunting in the Mojave: Vote on an amendment to the California Desert Protection Act that would make the East Mojave Scenic area a national preserve rather than a national park thereby allowing hunting to continue in the area. Approved 239 to 183, July 12. Connecticut 1. Kennelly (D) . . . Nay 2. Gejdenson (D) . . . Nay 3. DeLauro (D) . . . Nay 4. Shays (R) . . . Nay 5. Franks (R) . . . Nay 6. Johnson (R) . . .
